intro: Linaria reflexa subsp. doumetii, commonly known as the Alboraya or the Alboraya flower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sunny, open habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in Mediterranean climates.
